title: Pyrox Island
text: Pyrox Island is an island lying at the head of <a href="Neny%20Fjord">Neny Fjord</a>, along the west coast of <a href="Graham%20Land">Graham Land</a>. First surveyed by the <a href="United%20States%20Antarctic%20Service">United States Antarctic Service</a> (USAS), 1939–41. Resurveyed in 1949 by the <a href="Falkland%20Islands%20Dependencies%20Survey">Falkland Islands Dependencies Survey</a> (FIDS), who so named it because of pyroxenic rocks found there.
